intro: Astragalus arequipensis, commonly known as the Arequipa milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Peru. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to the extreme conditions of its native habitat. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest for its potential medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
